clusters.title: Learning Preferences
clusters.description: A survey of 781 Hong Kong students conducted from June to October 2020 revealed insights into their preferences and satisfaction with online learning. While 57% of students expressed satisfaction with their schools' online learning arrangements, only 49.6% found it to be an effective learning mode. A significant majority, 67.2%, preferred in-person schooling over online learning, with only 12.8% favoring the latter.

District school parents report the lowest satisfaction levels among the three groups, but a majority still express high satisfaction.
